alert.note: Alert for Brown; Callahan; Coleman; Runnels; Shackelford; Taylor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 10:55PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Callahan, Brown, Coleman, south central Shackelford, southern Taylor and northeastern Runnels Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1054 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near I-20 Near The Callahan-Eastland County Line to 6 miles northeast of Oplin to near Pumphrey. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abilene, Brownwood, Coleman, Clyde, Early, Winters, Baird, Santa Anna, Wylie, Bangs, Cross Plains, Tuscola, Buffalo Gap, Blanket, Lawn, Novice, Putnam, Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty, Cross Cut and Bradshaw. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 291 and 320. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for west central Texas.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Callahan; Coleman; Runnels; Shackelford; Taylor
